oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Remnant stock from a Springfield musket
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A battlefield relic--lower portion of wooden stock with metal trigger and guard--dug from Lookout Mountain (Tenn." presumably a remnant of the battle there on November 24, 1863.; The Federal victory at Lookout Mountain assured control of the Tennessee River and Chattanooga's railroads. The following spring, Gen. William T. Sherman used Chattanooga as a supply base for his march to Atlanta and the sea.
